Tips for Gameplay
The first part of your career you are a dedicated caster with some nice defensive boosts from Fighter and Monk.  Play as a Druid Summoner, and rely on spells to disable your enemy, such as Grease, Entangle, Spike Growth, Vine Mine, Creeping Doom, etc. Use your powerful summons and your Animal Companion as fodder while you bring the real damage via spells and a healthy sling AB.  You get Heavy Armor Proficiency early on to help you until Monk AC can really be useful.  At starting levels put your Improved Expertise to work.  Tank your oppenents and let your summons flank and overwhelm your enemy.  As your spell power grows, you'll find needing this less.
 
Longterm Buffs: Ultravision, Endure Elements, Barkskin, Camoflauge, One with Land, Empowered Bulls, Owl’s Insight,  Stoneskin, Greater Stoneskin, Death Ward, Spell Resistance, Premonition, Prot. From Elements, Energy Buffer, Freedom, Mass Camo, True Seeing
 
Short term Buffs: Blood Frenzy (and Extended), Extended Aura of Vitality, Regeneration (and Extended)
 
Merging: In Dragon Shape, only properties from armor, helmet and shield apply.  Seek items for those 3 slots to maximize merging goodness.  This is also true for Animal and Elemental Shape.  Remember that the Druid is able to easily achieve stat caps with Aura of Vitality (+4 to Strength, Dex and Con), empowered Bulls (+3-7), and Owl's Insight (+12 Wisdom).  With just +4 Dex and +4 Con/Str through an armor-related item, you can achieve the cap with potions of Cats Grace and Endurance.
 
Builder’s Commentary
This is one of my Dragon Shape variants that I like to run.  It is designed to be played from the ground up.  While not the highest AC possible (one could go Monk heavy for an addition 3 AC, or grab 2 more Great Wisdoms for another, this would grant an AC of 103!), this one is fairly close. With a 99 AC (it’s really 97 because of Huge size, but who cares), you insure you can never be critical-ed, or Dev Critted, and you are immune to Sneaks.  With over a 1000 hit points, you are what all Dragon Disciples dream of – an Engine of Irrevocable Destruction.  You can reliably hit enemies who have ACs in the 60s and 70s.  In order to achieve true form, you are powerful Druid caster for the first portion of your career.  Playing a Druid caster is different than playing other casters – it’s trickier and you have to know your enemies weaknesses.  You manage the battlefield with your spells that disable and hamper movement and then bring to bear your summons and offensive spells.  Your Zen Archery also comes into play and should allow you to fairly reliably from long range.  In the event you come across an opponent who has ACs higher that the mid 70s, turn on Improved Expertise and spam your Breath Weapon.
 
I chose not to take ESF: Conjuration in this build because by the time you get it, Dragon Shape is attained and it is no longer needed.  Your DCs are still higher than most. 
 
You get lots of skill points so feel free to adjust accordingly.  I found it useful to invest a little in both Hide and Move Silently and allow Druid Camo spell set, along with Trackless Step, to get those stealth skills up.
 
For those that say Dragon Shape is overpowered and banned on their PW, I say this: You’re right.  But have you seen the Druid Spell Lists? Pitiful to say the least.  While there are some winner spells, many are vastly underpowered and schemed for a Level 20 environment.  Dragon Shape, in my opinion, was the NWN creators way of throwing them a bone for hosing them with spells.  Like why no Cat’s Grace?  Anyway, I digress…
 
Final Note: If one wants to avoid XP penalty, just go with a Fighter4/Monk4 split.  You lose IKD but now you can use the 3rd fighter bonus feat for Armor Skin and free up a Druid Bonus feat for ESF: Conjuration.  I’d rather have the 1 AC and IKD, but that’s me.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
It's already maximized AB for the classes contained within.  The only way to make it higher with class construction is to take more of a class that provides a 1/1 BAB.  For instance, one could go 4 fighter levels in pre-epic (along with 12 druid/4 monk, or 16Druid/4 fighter) to gain 1 more AB.  I don't think it's worth it.

In the current set-up, your best bet is to maximize strength with some Bulls Strength and Extended Aura of Vitality to cap out your strength at 60.  You can then get more AB by quaffing potions of Bless and Aid for another 2 AB points.  Remember you can still suck on potions when shifted.  You can get more AB by entangling your opponents first in Stonehold/SoV and then get some situational AB for being flatfooted.  You can get another 2 points of AB if you make your opponents fight outdoors.

But Dragon Shapes, while they have a nice AB in low to mid magic settings, lose some of that value in high end magic environments.  But even still, you can get a decent AB around 59 with this one, so you can reliably hit ACs in the 60s and even 70s.  But if you have someone with an AC above 75ish, I would go into Druid form and take the opponent down with spells.  Or, you could go into Improved Expertise mode as Dragon and spam Breath Weapon and hope they don't have Evasion/Improved Evasion.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
Yes, it looks like laddie might need a wee bit of merging/shifting education.  I usually include the basics in all of my dragon and or shifter builds, but it's easy to miss and gloss over.

Armor, helmet, shield are the only things which merge with dragon.  When you are non-dragon, you really don't want the shield on because you want to run around with all of your monk goodness.  But what I do is I keep a quickslot dedicated for that shield so I tap it right before my merge.  However, if you don't have any properties to merge, there's no point.  

You only need the AC value from one of those 3 items.  If you have +6 robes, that will do.  Helmet and shield are all about properties.  

To further increase your AC, Barkskin for an immediate 5.  Owl's Insight will give you another 6.  Improved Expertise will give you 10.  There's 21 right there.  Cat's grace for another 2.  Armor Skin for another 2.  8 from Tumble. 1 natural from Monk AC.  13 from Dragon Dexterity.  Another 13 from 36 Wisdom. Another 20 Dodge from Dragon shape.  5 deflection from armor (assuming you have at least +5 armor or shield).  There, what's that take us to? 10 base, +5, +19 (wis), +10exp, +2+2+8+1+13+20+5 = 95.  And we haven't even added any dex bonus you might receive from a merged item. Or any haste item or potion.
